{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3491439,"name":"Dhruv","username":"DhruvVootkuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dhruvvootkuri/{size}/246270_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T05:50:42.659Z","cooked":"

Hey, I’ve been trying to solve this issue for a while now, but it seems like despite it being so common REV actually acknowledged it was a problem with the client, their fix still hasn’t worked for our team. I’m going to try and outline the overall issue as best as possible, let me know if there’s anything you want me to elaborate on.

We are currently attempting to update all of our SparkMAXes and configure their Device IDs, but we’ve been having some trouble with that second step. Without it, we’re basically stuck on the programming side since we can’t code anything at all, not even our drive base.

It started a few days ago when we first booted the REV HW Client. We tried one SparkMAX, which was detected perfectly and we had no issues updating it. About an hour later, we tried to configure the device ID. The client could not detect any hardware. We tried using all the different cables that came with the spark packaging, but it didn’t work. We then tried using a different SparkMAX, and even that wouldn’t detect all of a sudden, despite working the first time. We tried Recovery Mode, which the software could detect, but stopped detecting as soon as the device was updated.

We tried a completely new PC, of a different model as well. The same problem persisted, with the very first SparkMAX working, but then it stopped working after that unless we used Recovery Mode.

On both PCs, the SparkMAXes worked fine in recovery mode and stopped getting detected immediately after. On both PCs, the Power Distribution Hub could get detected, but not the SparkMAX. We reinstalled the software on each and even restarted the PCs.

It got even crazier when we went to a local veteran team to try and figure it out, and even they had no idea what was going on. It worked on one PC, but only because they had an older version, and we haven’t been able to code with those sparks.

A while ago, REV got back to us with a fix that’s been going around for a while apparently involving this thing called CleanUSBState. They admitted it as a potential issue in the software and gave us steps to fix it, but even that failed. We sent them a video of us doing all the steps, so they might be able to correct us procedurally, but we have no idea what to do anymore. The video itself might have sensitive information, so we won’t post it here, but we’re certain the procedure was done properly, as we have asked users privately and they agreed we have done it right.

We thought we made a breakthrough yesterday when we got a single SparkMAX configured, by connecting directly to the PDH, and it could be controlled with code as well. However, there were 4 sparks total hooked up, and only 2 got detected, and one of them wasn’t actually did anything when we tried changing settings or running the motor.

Today, we tried using recovery mode and combined that with the PDH. Only one spark works right now still.

Thoughts?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T05:50:42.659Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":144,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":758.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Dhruv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3491464,"name":"Quincy Tordil","username":"Gasper1747","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gasper1747/{size}/258826_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T07:15:13.476Z","cooked":"

Hi Dhruv, reading through this I had a couple of thoughts. Firstly, if the sparks are configured to the same CAN ID I do not believe they will act correctly. For example, If you have three Sparks with the same CAN ID, a single device might appear in the REV Hardware client under that CAN ID but you probably won’t be able to use that “device” which is what I think is happening here:

DhruvVootkuri:

there were 4 sparks total hooked up, and only 2 got detected, and one of them wasn’t actually did anything when we tried changing settings or running the motor.

Next, from reading, it seems like you try to connect to each SparkMax through the CAN bus starting at the PDH USB. This should be fine if all CAN devices have already been configured properly. For first-time configuring, I recommend plugging into each SparkMax USB one by one to make sure you are configuring the correct one. It also wouldn’t hurt to have it completely isolated from the CAN loop if disconnecting and reconnecting parts isn’t too hard. Make sure to burn flash when you are done configuring the SparkMax to save your changes.

These are my first thoughts and steps I’d recommend taking. If you cannot see a SparkMax by directly connecting to the USB-C port, that is a bigger/different issue. Posting screenshots of the REV Hardware Client and or pictures of the SparkMax while connected might help more if these steps don’t fix the issue.

I hope this helps.

I’ll link the REV SparkMax “Make it Spin!” page for those who might need it.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T07:15:13.476Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Quincy Tordil","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.revrobotics.com/brushless/spark-max/gs/make-it-spin","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Make it Spin! | REV ION Brushless","clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50882,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"461 Mentor|1747 Alum|FTAA, CSA and LRI"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/2","custom_user_title":"461 Mentor|1747 Alum|FTAA, CSA and LRI","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491491,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T09:04:55.998Z","cooked":"

I agree with @Gasper1747 on process, though having seen other comments about this (presumably from you), I suspect you’ve already tried this.

For initial configuration of CAN ID’s, I always recommend connecting via USB 1-by-1 (i.e. no CAN connected to anything, and not powered by the robot battery/PDH). After you’re certain they all have unique CAN ID’s, then you can chain them via CAN and power however you’d like, and they should all be visible in RHC. Of course, if youre impacted by some kind of bug in the REV stuff (whether RHC or firmware), using a bad cable, or have bad connections with CAN/missing terminating resistor), you may see weird behavior.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T09:04:55.998Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":109,"readers_count":108,"score":36.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/3","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491880,"name":"Dhruv","username":"DhruvVootkuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dhruvvootkuri/{size}/246270_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T20:01:08.424Z","cooked":"

Thank you for all the replies! I am unsure if the CAN IDs being the same are the issue, since even using a different CAN ID from the one that worked didn’t show any new devices on the PDH. On the point of isolating the SparkMAXes, we tried doing that as well, but the problems persisted. We only started using the PDH yesterday (day before the post) since it was the first time we could actually get a motor to turn. Before that, all we have done was use isolated Sparks, not connected to anything.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T20:01:08.424Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":23.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Dhruv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3491918,"name":"Travis Hoffman","username":"Travis_Hoffman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/travis_hoffman/{size}/161072_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-24T20:41:31.783Z","cooked":"

I was working with students to upgrade SparkMAX firmware yesterday - some were factory fresh; others had 2024 firmware loaded with CAN ID’s configured. I connected a new one to the PC directly with USB-C - no other power. It showed up and we flashed the firmware no issues. But then, it ceased to show up in the utility after that. We tried a number of things to remedy this, but to no avail.

What eventually worked was to hook the SparkMAX up to our bench control system via CAN - but ONLY ONE SparkMAX. We plugged the USB cable into the REV PDH board. The controller showed up in the config utility (along with the PDH and roboRIO).

We proceeded to configure each SparkMAX one by one (firmware update, complete factory reset, setup of CAN ID and other configurables) in this manner, with no issues. We have not tried to hook multiple configured controllers onto the CANbus to verify they all show up.

Obviously not an ideal situation - and one I’d hope would be addressed via some kind of utility update eventually - but this method worked for us.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-24T20:42:46.693Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":17.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Travis Hoffman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":71729,"username":"DhruvVootkuri","name":"Dhruv","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dhruvvootkuri/{size}/246270_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":262,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Blue Banner Free Since 2020"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/6","custom_user_title":"Blue Banner Free Since 2020","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3492119,"name":"Dhruv","username":"DhruvVootkuri","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dhruvvootkuri/{size}/246270_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T01:40:12.625Z","cooked":"

Hey, quick update based on a lot of fixes that were offered. We tried some sparks outside the CAN loop entirely (we used to do it with the PDH unpowered, so we tried it just completely taken apart. However, REV got back to us and we do have some new information: the Device Manager shows it as a driver fault. The system recognizes that it is in fact a SparkMAX but doesn’t have the driver to update it. Anybody know how to fix that?

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-25T01:40:12.625Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":76,"readers_count":75,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Dhruv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71729,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3492184,"name":"Joseph","username":"jvogel14","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e480ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T03:34:56.320Z","cooked":"

Hey had a similar problem today. Power off robot. Make sure you take PDH off your can bus and update it’s firmware from recovery mode. Then run the cmdlet Rev gave you and connect to a spark Max on USB and initiate recovery mode to flash firmware to 24.0.1. Now flash to 25.0.2 if it disappears or gets stuck on a screen saying rebooting unplug and replug the sparkmax. At this point it should be showing up in hardware client consistently. Take this time to assign a unique can id. I hope this helps!

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-01-25T03:34:56.320Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":72,"readers_count":71,"score":14.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":483349,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client","display_username":"Joseph","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":71729,"username":"DhruvVootkuri","name":"Dhruv","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dhruvvootkuri/{size}/246270_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58218,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-trouble-with-rev-hw-client/483349/8","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3492204,"name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","username":"Greg_Needel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T04:23:50.540Z","cooked":"

We identified the cause of this issue and have released an update to both the firmware and hardware client. Please update to Hardware Client 1.7.1 and Spark MAX 25.0.3 which addresses the issue with the MAX not being found by the client.

I noticed a lot of people discussing REV’s fix with the ClearUSBState.zip. To clarify, that still has not worked, but the computer has been telling us through the Device Manager that it is a driver issue, and it cannot update the driver because it cannot find the driver. Thoughts?
